programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team. Also in HD. [S] Including regional news at 25 and 55 minutes past each hour.
programme.title: Breakfast

programme.desc: 24/25. Series following the work of probate researchers. Ronald Fawcett died in Stoke-on-Trent in 2010 without leaving a will, so the heir hunters get to work tracking down his relatives.
programme.title: Heir Hunters

programme.desc: Martin Roberts and Lucy Alexander visit a house in Derby, a chapel in Chelmsford and a flat in London, and find out how much they sold for at auction. [S] Then BBC News; Weather.
programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer

programme.desc: Clive Holland has help for those who have fallen victim to cowboy builders. The team help a Surrey mum whose new kitchen has a bouncy floor - an indicator of serious problems.
programme.title: Cowboy Trap

programme.desc: 9/10. Gloria Hunniford investigates how people are fighting back against rogue traders. Today, the story of consumer swindled out of 143,000 by builders. Also in HD. [S] Then BBC News; Weather.
programme.title: Doorstep Crime 999

programme.subtitle: Shepton Mallet
programme.desc: Antiques challenge. Experts Philip Serrell and Anita Manning lead the teams on a hunt in Shepton Mallet. Tim Wonnacott finds inspiration at the John Soane Museum.
programme.title: Bargain Hunt

programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team, followed by weather.

programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather for the Midlands.

programme.subtitle: Embers
programme.desc: Elaine goes back to school to hold a careers seminar, but the teacher needs her help. Also in HD. [AD,S]
programme.title: Doctors

programme.subtitle: Carmarthenshire
programme.desc: Property series. Nicki Chapman helps a couple who are seeking an impressive house to retire to in South Wales. They have a healthy budget of 650,000 pounds.
programme.title: Escape to the Country

programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team, followed by weather.
programme.title: BBC News

programme.desc: CBBC. Behind the Scenes: Steve Backshall looks back at his favourite encounters from the wildlife series, from abseiling into a cave looking for bats to a thrilling meeting with a hippo.
programme.title: Deadly 60

programme.desc: CBBC. Computer Mayhem: Comedy series. Liam attempts to convince Dylan he has shut down the traffic light system and is causing traffic chaos. [S] Then Diddy Dick and Dom.
programme.title: Prank Patrol Down Under

programme.desc: CBBC. Sam and Mark host as two families battle it out in a range of hilarious games, like Quick on the Draw, Mime Time, Music Round, and the formidable Copycats Challenge. Also in HD.
programme.title: Copycats

programme.desc: CBBC. 13/13. All for One: Supernatural drama. Bertrand believes that if he reads the last words of the Praedictum Impaver, all the power within the book will go to him. Also in HD.
programme.title: Young Dracula

programme.desc: CBBC. Topical news magazine for children.
programme.title: Newsround

programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else can think of.
programme.title: Pointless

programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather for the Midlands.

programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones bring you the stories that matter from across the country. Also in HD.
programme.title: The One Show

programme.desc: Jay struggles to cope with his grim discovery and makes a decision that could affect his life forever - but will someone prevent him from going through with it? Also in HD. [AD,S] Then BBC News.
programme.title: EastEnders

programme.subtitle: Bash Cash
programme.desc: Documentary series. The traffic cops come across a suspicious accident on an empty motorway sliproad that bears the hallmarks of an insurance-cheating 'crash for cash'. Also in HD.
programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.desc: 2/2. The remaining pensioners face competition from genuine young job seekers. Also in HD. [AD,S]
programme.title: The Town that Never Retired

programme.desc: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.

programme.desc: A political review of the week presented by Andrew Neil, with Michael Portillo, Alan Johnson and guests.

programme.desc: Detailed weather forecast.

programme.desc: ...the 70s? - Panorama. Panorama asks whether Britain is able to cope with a new age of austerity. [S,SL]
programme.title: Britain on the Brink: Back to...

programme.desc: This episode of Countryfile comes from the Kent hills. Ellie Harrison follows in the footsteps of Octavia Hill, social reformer and founder of the National Trust. [S,SL]
programme.title: Countryfile

programme.subtitle: Birmingham University
programme.desc: A second visit to Birmingham University for the team as they embark on a busy day of valuations, with objects including the biggest vases seen on the show. [S,SL]
programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

programme.desc: 10/10. A look at crime and punishment in modern Britain. Louise Minchin and Gethin Jones chart the changes in crime, criminals, police and prisons over the last 60 years. [S,SL]
programme.title: Crime and Punishment

programme.subtitle: South West Main
programme.desc: Chefs Paul Ainsworth, Nathan Outlaw and Simon Hulstone cook their main courses, but who will take gold? Great British Menu veteran Tom Kerridge scores the dishes. [S,SL]

programme.subtitle: South West Dessert
programme.desc: It's the chefs' final chance to impress, this time presenting their desserts. Dishes include elderflower and lemon tart with strawberry sorbet and meringues. [S,SL]
programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.desc: BBC One joins the BBC's rolling news channel for a night of news, with bulletins on the hour and the headlines every 15 minutes.
